intro: Galium × ochroleucum var. effugens, commonly known as the white wood-sorrel, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in ornamental gardening due to their delicate appearance.
